title: Lawn-care worker to employer
context: Ask the homeowner if they want the grass clippings bagged up.

content.bestLine: Do you want me to bag the grass clippings?

neutral.text: Do you want the clippings bagged?
Can I leave the clippings or bag them?
What do you prefer for the grass clippings?
Do you need the clippings bagged up?
Should the grass clippings be bagged?
Can I bag the grass for you?
Do you want the lawn clippings disposed of?

formal.text: Would you like the grass clippings bagged and disposed of?
Is it your preference to have the lawn clippings bagged?
Shall I collect the grass clippings in bags for you?
Do you require the grass clippings to be bagged after mowing?
Would you prefer the clippings to be left on the lawn or bagged?
Is bagging the grass clippings part of your lawn care preferences?

patterns.template: Do you want me to [options] the grass clippings?
patterns.meaning: Asking about the preferred disposal method for grass clippings
Inquiring about the preferred action for lawn clippings

dialogs.description: Lawn-care worker asking about bagging grass clippings

lines.speaker: Lawn-care worker
lines.text: Do you want me to bag the grass clippings?

lines.speaker: Employer
lines.text: Yes, please. I prefer them bagged.

dialogs.description: Employer instructing lawn-care worker on clippings disposal

lines.speaker: Employer
lines.text: Remember to bag the grass clippings after you mow.

lines.speaker: Lawn-care worker
lines.text: Will do. I'll make sure to bag them up for you.
